Buffalo Public SchoolsIndex 0: Public School #1, known as School 1, was located in the Lakeview neighborhood. It served grades K through 8 until it was closed in 1976 and has since been demolished.
Buffalo Public SchoolsIndex 1: Public School #2, or School 2, situated in the Downtown area, catered to students from kindergarten to grade 8. It closed its doors in 1961 and has been demolished.
Buffalo Public SchoolsIndex 4: Located in the Babcock neighborhood, Public School #7, referred to as School 7, served grades K-8 until it was closed in 1950. The building has been demolished.
Buffalo Public SchoolsIndex 5: Public School #8, named Follow Through Urban Learning Lab School, was in the Masten Park area. It offered education from kindergarten through grade 8 until 2004. The building is now vacant.

Buffalo Public SchoolsIndex 7: Public School #10, known as School 10, served the Downtown community from kindergarten through grade 8 until it shut down in 1955. The building has since been demolished.
Buffalo Public SchoolsIndex 8: In Schiller Park, Public School #11, also known as Poplar Academy, provided education from kindergarten through grade 4 until its closure in 2009. The building remains vacant.
Buffalo Public SchoolsIndex 9: Harriet Ross Tubman Early Childhood Center, also known as Public School #12, was located in Willert Park. It served grades K-4 until it closed in 2005. The building now houses the Office of Special Education.
Buffalo Public SchoolsIndex 11: Public School #14, or School 14, situated in Downtown, catered to students from kindergarten to grade 8. It was closed in the 1930s and has been demolished.
Buffalo Public SchoolsIndex 12: Located in Downtown, Public School #15, known as School 15, served grades K-8 until its closure in 1965. The building has been demolished.
Buffalo Public SchoolsIndex 13: Public School #16, or School 16, was situated in the Bryant neighborhood. It catered to grades K-8 until it closed in 1976. The building has since been converted into private apartments.

Buffalo Public SchoolsIndex 16: Located in Central Park, Public School #22, known as School 22, catered to grades K-8 until it shut down in 1980. The building has been repurposed into private apartments.

Buffalo Public SchoolsIndex 18: School 24, known as Public School #24, was located in the Broadway-Fillmore area and served grades K-8 until it closed in 2002. The building remains vacant.
